TypeSignature.Value: .class public sequential ansi sealed beforefieldinit GCMemoryInfo extends System.ValueType

Docs.summary: Provides a set of APIs that can be used to retrieve garbage collection information.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
A garbage collection (GC) is identified by its <xref:System.GCMemoryInfo.Index>, which starts from 1 and increases with each GC. If you ask for a GC that doesn't exist, you'll get all 0's in the info, including the <xref:System.GCMemoryInfo.Index>. For example, you'll get 0's if you call the <xref:System.GC.GetGCMemoryInfo%2A> method before a GC has happened, or you ask for a GC of <xref:System.GCKind.FullBlocking?displayProperty=nameWithType> and no full blocking GCs have happened. You can use index 0 to detect that no GCs, or no GCs of the kind you specified, have occurred.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Compacted As Boolean
public: property bool Compacted { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates if this is a compacting GC or not.
Docs.value: if this is a compacting GC; otherwise.
Docs.remarks: A compacting GC is when space occupied by dead objects is reclaimed and surviving objects are compacted.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Concurrent As Boolean
public: property bool Concurrent { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates if this is a concurrent GC (background GC) or not.
Docs.value: if this is a concurrent GC (background GC); otherwise.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property FinalizationPendingCount As Long
public: property long FinalizationPendingCount { long get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the number of objects that are ready for finalization that this GC observed.
Docs.value: The total number of objects observed by this GC that are ready for finalization.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property FragmentedBytes As Long
public: property long FragmentedBytes { long get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the total fragmentation when the last garbage collection occurred.
Docs.value: The total fragmentation when the last garbage collection occurred.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
For example, the application has the following five objects:
`| OBJ_A | OBJ_B | OBJ_C | OBJ_D | OBJ_E |`
If `OBJ_B`, `OBJ_C`, and `OBJ_E` are garbage collected but the heap is not compacted, the resulting heap will look like the following:
`| OBJ_A | F | OBJ_D |`
The memory between `OBJ_A` and `OBJ_D`, which is marked `F`, is considered part of the `FragmentedBytes` and is used to allocate new objects.
The memory after `OBJ_D` is not considered part of the `FragmentedBytes` but is also used to allocate new objects.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Generation As Integer
public: property int Generation { int get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the generation this GC collected. Collecting a generation also collects younger generations.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property GenerationInfo As ReadOnlySpan(Of GCGenerationInfo)
public: property ReadOnlySpan<GCGenerationInfo> GenerationInfo { ReadOnlySpan<GCGenerationInfo> get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the generation information for all generations.
Docs.value: The generation information for all generations.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property HeapSizeBytes As Long
public: property long HeapSizeBytes { long get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the total heap size when the last garbage collection occurred.
Docs.value: The total heap size, in bytes, when the last garbage collection occurred.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property HighMemoryLoadThresholdBytes As Long
public: property long HighMemoryLoadThresholdBytes { long get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the high memory load threshold when the last garbage collection occurred.
Docs.value: The high memory load threshold, in bytes, when the last garbage collection occurred.
Docs.remarks: Most of the GC performance heuristics are based on per-process measurements. However, to avoid paging, GC is aware of the global physical memory load on the machine or VM or in the container. GC recognizes a certain memory load percentage as a "high memory load situation". When the memory load percentage is over that threshold, GC becomes more aggressive and will do more full blocking GCs if necessary to reduce the heap size.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Index As Long
public: property long Index { long get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the index of this GC.
Docs.remarks: GC indices start with 1 and are increased at the beginning of a GC. Since the information is updated at the end of a GC, this means you can get the information for a background GC with a smaller index than a foreground GC that finished earlier.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property MemoryLoadBytes As Long
public: property long MemoryLoadBytes { long get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the physical memory load when the last garbage collection occurred.
Docs.value: The physical memory load, in bytes, when the last garbage collection occurred.

remarks.para: On Windows, memory load is a field in the [MEMORYSTATUS structure](/windows/win32/api/winbase/ns-winbase-memorystatus). It's a number between 0 and 100 that specifies the approximate percentage of physical memory that's in use (0 indicates no memory use and 100 indicates full memory use). Corresponding information is given on other operating systems.

Data is only brought into physical memory on first touch. If you allocated a big object but haven't actually used it, most of its memory isn't in physical memory. In this case, the allocation won't affect the memory load significantly.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property PauseDurations As ReadOnlySpan(Of TimeSpan)
public: property ReadOnlySpan<TimeSpan> PauseDurations { ReadOnlySpan<TimeSpan> get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the durations of the pauses when all managed threads are suspended.
Docs.value: A timespan representing the pause durations.
Docs.remarks: For blocking GCs, there is one pause. Pauses for background GC are illustrated at [Background workstation vs. server GC](/dotnet/standard/garbage-collection/background-gc#background-workstation-vs-server-gc).

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property PauseTimePercentage As Double
public: property double PauseTimePercentage { double get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the pause time percentage in the GC so far. If the pause time is 1.2%, this property's value is 1.2. The value is calculated by taking the sum of all GC pauses so far and dividing that by the total elapsed time of the process since the runtime was loaded. This running counter is updated at the end of each GC. It does not distinguish between . That is, at every GC, the calculated value is updated, and when you access this property, it gets the latest calculated value.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property PinnedObjectsCount As Long
public: property long PinnedObjectsCount { long get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the number of pinned objects this GC observed.
Docs.value: The total number of pinned objects observed by this GC.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property PromotedBytes As Long
public: property long PromotedBytes { long get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the promoted bytes for this GC.
Docs.value: The number of promoted bytes for this GC.
Docs.remarks: The promoted bytes represent the objects from the generations that the garbage collection is collecting that survived.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property TotalAvailableMemoryBytes As Long
public: property long TotalAvailableMemoryBytes { long get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the total available memory for the garbage collector to use when the last garbage collection occurred.
Docs.value: The total available memory, in bytes, for the garbage collector to use when the last garbage collection occurred.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
This property value will be the value of the `COMPlus_GCHeapHardLimit` environment variable, or the `Server.GC.HeapHardLimit` value in `runtimeconfig.json`, if either is set.
If the program is run in a container, this value is an implementation-defined fraction of the container's size.
Otherwise, the value of the property is the physical memory on the machine that was available for the garbage collector to use when the last garbage collection occurred.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property TotalCommittedBytes As Long
public: property long TotalCommittedBytes { long get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the total committed bytes of the managed heap.
Docs.value: The total committed bytes of the managed heap.
Docs.remarks: The total committed bytes is the amount of backing store for the memory. On Windows, bytes are committed when `VirtualAlloc` is called with `MEM_COMMIT`. On Linux, bytes are committed when the page mapping is changed to PROT_WRITE | PROT_READ.
